Topic.Title: what are the chances of yahoo being bought this week-end?

Message.Msg: In yours dreams? You bet. Just visualize the highest bidder accepting the keys Monday.

Message.Title: Reason to not jump into YHOO?
Message.Msg: I have been trading this since $19 and made great money selling and buying the small pull backs. Now I am just going to go long. I can't think if a reason not to?? Does anyone have a reason to stay out of yahoo. I'm not trying to wise here, totally serious.

Topic.Title: Reason to not jump into YHOO?

Message.Msg: Nope...Buybacks, Alibaba, YJ, forwards, Mobile expansion, new homepages for individual properties coming, new search.

Topic.Title: Reason to not jump into YHOO?

Message.Msg: I think there is much more upside from here with so many catalysts in the next 8 months. At least $50+ by the end of the year. Hulu will be huge if they can pull it off. The bottom line is that Yahoo is relevant again and everyone is talking about the company now and MM. Image is changing and Yahoo is becoming a household name again!!!

Message.Title: "Yahoo’s Bid for Hulu in $600M to $800M Range — Even as It Preps Other Big Deals in Mobile and Communications"
Message.Msg: Headline form ATD. Nice piece - like we thought - very complicated negotiations. This section struck me: "Chernin’s bid, as had been widely reported, started in the $500 million range, which is interesting since the longtime Hollywood executive was once the COO of News Corp. and was critical to Hulu’s creation. Translation: He’d know just what the video platform worth and how the place works." As I said last week Yahoo!'s Mickie Rosen was also an important part of Hulu's creation. Also, I have read that Chernin's bid was 500 million + 330 million towards debt.

Topic.Title: Reason to not jump into YHOO?

Message.Msg: lardcakes???LOL I challenge you to a powerlifting challenge and a 3 mile timed run. I can take ya. b pressing 455 for reps and deadlifting 405 for reps of 10-15. squatting tremendous amounts. i crush softballs for team easton as well well over 450ft. shots
Those are good. I have a bunch. Should get you a very nice return.

Topic.Title: Reason to not jump into YHOO?

Message.Msg: Significant upside potential with very limited downside considering the after tax cake of Asian assets is more than current market cap

MM will be there at least two years unless we have a buyout. With MM at the helm, rest assured this baby will go higher. We are just starting to feeling good about YHOO. I like the idea but I don't do option. This is my personal opinion only.

Topic.Title: "Yahoo’s Bid for Hulu in $600M to $800M Range — Even as It Preps Other Big Deals in Mobile and Communications"

Message.Msg: Agreed Yahoo must offer the best price. However, the sellers will be expected much more than this offer. My "guess" selling price would be at least $1 billion dollars....

Topic.Title: "Yahoo’s Bid for Hulu in $600M to $800M Range — Even as It Preps Other Big Deals in Mobile and Communications"

Message.Msg: Right & we don't know what their offer is for - partnership of some sort or all? The more I read, the more I think you are right on it being a partnership. I did note that Google did not bid. I believe they had the highest bid in the last auction before Hulu cancelled the process.

Topic.Title: "Yahoo’s Bid for Hulu in $600M to $800M Range — Even as It Preps Other Big Deals in Mobile and Communications"

Message.Msg: Goog is already under Anti-trust violation regarding their acquistion of DoubleClick.

Topic.Title: "Yahoo’s Bid for Hulu in $600M to $800M Range — Even as It Preps Other Big Deals in Mobile and Communications"

Message.Msg: ? That didn't stop them from bidding the first time Hulu went to auction. In Oct/2011 Google did bid & according to reports, they were the high bidder. Hulu then decided to cancel auction & it was thought they were going the IPO route.

Topic.Title: "Yahoo’s Bid for Hulu in $600M to $800M Range — Even as It Preps Other Big Deals in Mobile and Communications"

Message.Msg: GOOG is not in the mix and Hulu isn't doing an IPO. They are a completely disfunctional family looking for a divorce at this point. Yahoo is going to score big!!!

Message.Msg: Ha. Yes - don't think the IPO was talked about much after Providence cashed out.

Message.Msg: As we said before partnership likely with Disney if that's the direction. That would be a great fit.

Message.Msg: MM will not stop upgrading YHOO until she is satisfied or seeing a sustainable growth path for YHOO. I hope her main goal is to YHOO triple digit. She is a billionaire and we are rich in $$$$$$$$$ baby!!
